entry.title: Eddie Diaz vs Secret Santa
entry.summary:
Author: orionandhisdog

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,548Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: It's five minutes into the Secret Santa exchange, and Eddie is panicking. He's not panicking because the envelope containing his love letter is currently in Buck's hands, folded edges falling victim to the prodding of Buck's restless fingers. No, he actually feels good about the letter.  What he does not feel good about is the fact that he missed a memo. A very important memo. A very important memo that would have entirely changed his approach to the letter-writing portion of this gift exchange. Because if Eddie had known that everyone was going to read the notes they received out loud, for the entire group to hear, then he might have left the love confession out. or It’s scary enough for Eddie to write a love letter for Buck. The threat of a public reading of the letter doesn’t make it any better.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

I'm not really the greatest at writing but i sure do damn try. Also don't mind the medical inaccuracies, i did research to the best of my ability. entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 505,502Chapters: 56/?Kudos: 67

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 311,308Chapters: 49/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 203,686Chapters: 35/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Still water reflecting
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,717Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 37

Summary: After months of personal struggles and the mounting pressure of city life, Buck disappears into the quiet of an Amish community to heal. As the 118 scrambles to find him, Buck discovers stillness, perspective, and the courage to face his fears. Through letters, patient mentorship, and simple days in the countryside, he begins to understand the meaning of home. When he returns, he must rebuild his bonds with Eddie, Christopher, and the firehouse—learning that peace can exist alongside chaos, love can coexist with responsibility, and belonging is something he can finally embrace.

entry.title: lying here i count the hours
entry.summary:
Author: buckleyioncourt

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,680Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 28

Summary: Eddie returned his attention to a smug Buck, who was once again leaning on a doorframe like the structural integrity of the building depended on it. Eddie’s sanity, in contrast, depended on Buck not leaning like that, not crossing his lithe legs and holding himself up like he’d happily collapse the second Eddie told him to fall into him instead. “Close call there, Chief,” Buck half-whispered. Eddie knew that tone. This was about to be the longest shift of his life–a refrain he’d renewed every day since Buck had mastered their godforsaken game. “You almost revealed that we spend time at each other’s houses,” he mockingly gasped as leaned toward Eddie, close enough so that Eddie could still smell his own coffee on Buck’s breath. Remnants of the final kiss he’d stolen when they’d parked the truck, a sincere desire that was also an attempt to appeal to Buck’s merciful side. As Buck stood in front of him now, though, Eddie remembered why he’d abandoned the concept of mercy at the altar. Appeals to such whims were rarely successful. or__buddie makes their secret relationship into the dumbest game ever. apologies to the 118. especially ravi.

entry.title: Nobody's Son
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,303Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 178

Summary: Buck’s phone starts ringing in his pocket. He sighs and checks the caller ID, staring in confusion at the unfamiliar number. “Uh, hello?” “Hello there, is this Evan Buckley?” A woman’s voice is heard through the phone. “May I ask who’s calling?” “My name is Hope Williams, from Child Protective Services. I was wondering if you had a moment to schedule a meeting on behalf of Charlotte Davis?” “I-I’m sorry, I think you must have called the wrong Evan Buckley. Who is Charlotte Davis?”   Or Buck finds out he has a 7-year-old daughter. Buck finds out a lot of stuff, actually. Title based on the Sabrina Carpenter song

entry.title: Something Just Like This
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,356Chapters: 6/12Kudos: 37

Summary: “We have a vacancy, Buck,” Eddie shook his head. “And she’s really nice.” “Maybe that’s the problem!” Buck shot back, an awful bite to his tone that he hated himself for immediately. Buck shuddered slightly as he felt Eddie's hand slip into his and give it a squeeze. “Talk to me Buck.” He pleaded. “It’s stupid.” Buck mumbled. “It isn’t if it’s bothering you this much, you’re almost acting like-” Eddie prompted, realisation setting in all of a sudden, his eyes softening completely as he understood. “You’re scared?”   or   The 118 gain a new Probie and Buck is anything but pleased, determined more than ever to keep them at arms length.He just got Eddie and Christopher back in his life and life at the 118 is finally starting to settle, and he just can't handle any more changes.What he doesn't realise is that he and probationary firefighter Rosie Bishop actually have an awful lot in common.   Buddie beginnings + firefam feels, as the team heals and learns to open their hearts again, helping a young girl find her place in a very lonely world along the way.

entry.title: War of Hearts
entry.summary:
Author: Sunset_Swerve_76

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,564Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Kendall Bennet was facing an existential crisis and moved to Los Angeles like every other girl her age. While there, she stumbles upon her estranged Uncle Bobby Nash. He encourages her to become a paramedic, and when she ends up at his firehouse, she not only meets a newfound family but also two men who will change her life forever. Evan Buckley and Eddie Diaz will save her and be the death of her at the same time. She could never love two men more than she does her idiot firefighter boyfriends.

entry.title: Deck The Halls
entry.summary:
Author: sassay

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,478Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: While the room initially looked like a complete disaster, it doesn’t actually take that long for Buck to tidy up. Unfortunately some of the ornaments have broken so the decor is looking a little sparse but it still looks good, even if the tree is also a little lop-sided now too. “It’s still good,” Buck tries to convince himself as he tilts his head to match the tree’s angle, “It’s got character and personality now, that’s all.” Buck has a whole house this year to decorate, inside and out. He's determined to make it look amazing and is maybe going a little overboard, but long as the kids like it right? Only, it looks like the Christmas Spirit of Decorating maybe has it out for our dear Buck... DAY 6 PROMPT - DECORATING
